intro: Oerstedianthus brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed ericoid, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. Oerstedianthus brevipes is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
